thread.title: Kodak Black Takes On the KKK in Fiery 'Tunnel Vision' Video: Watch
thread.title_full: Kodak Black Takes On the KKK in Fiery 'Tunnel Vision' Video: Watch

author: NHHMS
title: Kodak Black Takes On the KKK in Fiery 'Tunnel Vision' Video: Watch
text:
http://www.billboard.com/files/styles/promo_225/public/media/kodak-black-tunnel-vision-2017-billboard-1548.jpg 
On Thursday (Feb. 16), Kodak Black released his provocative video for “Tunnel Vision,” taking aim at racists and the Ku Klux Klan. 
The visual illustrates a white man sporting a “Make America Hate Again” hat preparing to shoot a black man standing outside in a field. After realizing that the attacker’s gun is jammed up, the two square off in a heated skirmish. 
Later, Black takes aim at the KKK by standing in front of a burning cross. As he dances and raps away in front of his crew, a nearby KKK effigy is spotted hanging on a cross. 
“I jumped out of that wraith, Kodak bought a wraith/ I get any girl I want, any girl I want/ She want me to save the day, but I ain’t got a cape,” the Florida MC raps on the Metro Boomin’ and Southside-produced beat. 
Black will join Future on his Nobody Safe Tour alongside Migos and Tory Lanez , kicking off this May in Memphis. 
Check out the Michael Garcia-directed video below. 
[embedded content]
